item.description:
# "is" vs "=="
>>> a = [1, 2, 3] >>> b = a
>>> a is b True >>> a == b True
>>> c = list(a)
>>> a == c True >>> a is c False
# â¢ "is" expressions evaluate to True if two # variables point to the same object
# â¢ "==" evaluates to True if the objects # referred to by the variables are equal If you enjoyed this Python Trick you'll LOVE this: Python Tricks: The BookIf you think your friends would find this tip usefu...
